comments.body:
Is there a reason to skip windows and not just use `noarch: python`?

https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/knowledge_base.html#noarch-python

I'm not sure if every dependency is available on windows, but if they are, we should strive to make thie `noarch`.
Not every dependency is available on Windows - I've added a comment to that effect.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@build:
  number: 0
  skip: True  # [win]
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
